description: Utilization of a cluster on a node level, focusing on requests

options.content:
This dashboard helps to analyze node resource (CPU and RAM) utilization based on resource requests.

**Utilization** is the ratio of resources requested by workloads, divided by the total amount of resources provided by the node. As the cluster owner, your general aim should be to keep both memory and CPU utilization high, to avoid paying for unused resources. On the other hand, you want to keep head room, as maximized utilization can lead to increased latency and instability.

For CPU, the basis in this dashboard is _allocatable_ CPU as provided by the `kube_node_status_allocatable` metric. This will differ from the _physical_ number of cores.

panels.description: Number of nodes of the selected role currently (at the end of the selected time window)

targets.expr: count(kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"})

panels.title: Nodes

panels.description: Number of nodes of the selected role in condition Ready, currently (at the end of the selected time window)

targets.expr: count(kube_node_status_condition{cluster_id="$cluster",condition="Ready",status="true"})

panels.title: Nodes ready

panels.description: Most recent utilization based on resource requests divided by the allocatable resource

targets.expr:
avg(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
        (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
        /
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
)

avg(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
        /
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: Resource utilization

panels.description: Total of memory available in nodes currently (at the end of the selected time window)

targets.expr:
sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: Allocatable memory

panels.description: Total memory requests in nodes currently (at the end of the selected time window)

targets.expr:
sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: Memory requests

panels.description: Total CPU cores available in nodes currently (at the end of the selected time window)

targets.expr:
sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: Allocatable CPU

panels.description: Total CPU requests in nodes currently (at the end of the selected time window)

targets.expr:
sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: CPU requests

targets.expr: count(kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"})

panels.description: Total of memory requests, divided by the total memory available in nodes

targets.expr:
avg(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
        /
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: Memory request utilization average

panels.description: Total of memory requests in nodes

targets.expr:
sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: Memory request total

panels.description: Total CPU requests, divided by the amount of CPU available in nodes

targets.expr:
avg(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
        /
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
)

panels.title: CPU requests utilization average

targets.expr:
sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
)

sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
        /
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
) without (app, cluster_id, cluster_type, container, customer, endpoint, installation, instance, job, namespace, organization, pipeline, pod, provider, service, service_priority)

sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node)
    )
) without (app, cluster_id, cluster_type, container, customer, endpoint, installation, instance, job, namespace, organization, pipeline, pod, provider, service, service_priority)

sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
        /
        sum(kube_node_status_allocatable{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
) without (app, cluster_id, cluster_type, container, customer, endpoint, installation, instance, job, namespace, organization, pipeline, pod, provider, service, service_priority)

sum(
    kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
    + on(node) group_left()
    (
        sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node)
    )
) without (app, cluster_id, cluster_type, container, customer, endpoint, installation, instance, job, namespace, organization, pipeline, pod, provider, service, service_priority)

sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="memory"}) by (node, namespace, pod, container, uid)
+ on(node) group_left() kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0

sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster_id="$cluster",resource="cpu"}) by (node, namespace, pod, container, uid)
+ on(node) group_left() kube_node_info{cluster_id="$cluster"} * 0
